mods.abstract: ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS REWARD. Ran away from Sligo Plantation, Adams county, Miss., September 21, 1857, the boy FORTUNE, dark complexion, about 5 feet 5 inches high, broad featured, with scar over one eye, and one leg and ankle much enlarged by varicose veins. He will attempt to reach a free State, engage on some boat or very likely like about New Orleans. Will not give his owner's name. I will give $50 for his apprehension, if caught and confined in jail in Mississippi or Louisiana; and $100 if out of either of these States and confined as above, and information communicated to met at Natchez. DAVID P. WILLIAMS. o7 4t&4t W
